Sheet1.title: Data Analyst
Sheet1.description:
In order to be considered for this role, after clicking "apply now" above and being redirected, you must fully complete the application process on the follow-up screen.

Who We Are...

IMG Academy is the world's leading sports education brand, providing a holistic education model that empowers student-athletes to win their future, preparing them for college and for life. IMG Academy offers an innovative suite of on-campus and online experiences, providing growth opportunities for all student-athletes through:
â€¢ Boarding school and camps, via a 600-acre state-of-the-art campus in Bradenton, Fla. ()
â€¢ Online coaching via the IMG Academy+ brand, with a focus on personal development through the lens of sport and performance (/Plus)
â€¢ Online college recruiting, via the NCSA brand, providing content, tools, coaching and access to a network of 40,000 college coaches (ncsasports.org)
Our team has a deep appreciation for the transformative power of sports and holistic personal development. Our leadership is actively investing in the growth of the organization. We continue to broaden and deepen our technology platform and team in pursuit of our vision for empowering youth sports and the path-to-college for student-athletes.

Position Overview
The Data Analyst will be responsible for designing and implementing analytics solutions as part of the Data Team. The team provides data, analysis, insights and recommendations in support of the company's fiercely data-driven decision-making culture in sales, operational, financial and product domains. The Data Analyst is responsible for partnering cross-functionally across the organization to understand business goals, define questions and methods for answering them. The position makes use of multiple data sources, analysis tools and statistical frameworks to construct analytical outputs, reporting and dashboards in support of daily operations, new initiatives, and the development of proprietary predictive models. Working closely with the Data Engineering team and the Platform Development Manager for data infrastructure, the Data Analyst both makes use of and provides ongoing recommendations for improving the company's platform components for data collection, aggregation, processing and storage. The position serves as an enabler for decision-making around one or more major areas of business focus, providing key insights for senior management, operational leaders, and the Product and Technology teams.

The ideal candidate should have experience performing detailed analysis, working cross-functionally with business stakeholders and data engineering teams, sustaining mission-critical reporting and insights delivery. They should be very comfortable providing insights to business leaders using descriptive, diagnostic, and predictive analytics. They should demonstrate a rigorous scientific approach, using experimental methods to test hypotheses across multiple data sets using peer-reviewed statistical methods to ensure optimal business performance. Above all else, they should be a servant leader who understands their primary role to be supporting and enabling their team by maintaining a healthy, supportive culture.

Position Responsibilities
â€¢ Use data processing, querying and analysis tools to answer business questions and provide actionable insights.
â€¢ Use visualization tools to communicate stories with data, creating reporting, dashboards, KPI monitoring and self-service tools to make data and insights available for stakeholders.
â€¢ Facilitate the acquisition and integration of data from multiple data sources, performing exploratory analysis to identify data relationships including trends, patterns and correlations; mature these analyses into more formalized frameworks and models.
â€¢ Help the Data Team cultivate cross-functional partnerships across departments, bringing insights to every corner of our operation as part of a collaborative, collegial learning culture.
â€¢ Support leadership in Marketing, Sales Operations, Sales, Operations, Product and Technology to solicit analytics business requirements and frame actionable questions.
â€¢ Partner with other data analysts and data engineers to identify and address limitations in data sources, data quality, tooling, or performance bottlenecks in analytics delivery.
â€¢ Develop and maintain increasing awareness of the business context and dynamics surrounding each of the company's business units, their products and services, the data they generate and the relationships between them.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
â€¢ Bachelor's degree in a quantitative discipline (Mathematics or Social Science).
â€¢ 3 to 5 years' data analytics experience in a commercial or scientific setting.
â€¢ Experience supporting critical analytics delivery in a fast-paced environment.
â€¢ Experience working across functional, product and engineering teams.
â€¢ Experience using task management and collaboration software such as Jira or Trello.
â€¢ Experience with distributed version control and software development lifecycle methods.
â€¢ Understanding of how modern analytics frameworks are constructed to define questions and answers using applied statistical methods.
â€¢ Experience with a data science programming language like R or Python.
â€¢ Experience with composing complex SQL queries for relational databases.
â€¢ Hands-on experience building custom visualizations using tools like Tableau or Power BI.
â€¢ Some experience with ELT and data integration tools like Fivetran or Stitch Data.
â€¢ Some experience with modern data warehouse tools like Snowflake, Big Query, or Redshift.
â€¢ Some experience with data modeling and schema definition for data lakes and warehouses.
â€¢ Experience working cross-functionally in situations requiring collaboration, negotiation and communication of complex analyses to non-technical or senior management audiences.
â€¢ Excellent visual, verbal and textual communication and presentation skills; extremely strong skills for using data to tell stories, especially counter-intuitive or controversial ones.
â€¢ Highly self-motivated, self-directed, resourceful and autonomous; capable of managing multiple simultaneous deliverables with proactive status updates and requests for support.
â€¢ Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to quickly and efficiently pinpoint and resolve problematic issues.
â€¢ Comfortable working in a fast paced and dynamic environment.
Preferred Skills
â€¢ Exposure to Agile Development or the Scrum project management methodology a plus.

Don't meet every single requirement? We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, authentic workplace, so if you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfect with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles

Job Summary: The Data Analyst oversees data production for the Wildland Fire program and ensures the quality of the data produced. This position is on site and works in the Chloeta Catastrophe Command Center (Cat Center) alongside a variety of technical disciplines. Supervisory Responsibilities: No Job Classification: Permanent, full-time employee with benefits Compensation: Non-exempt $19 - 39 per hour Chloeta reserves the right to offer any candidate above or below the listed compensation amount based on experience or business needs.

Duties/Responsibilities: Oversees and manages assigned project and/or department data, ensuring it meets predetermined contractual or policy requirements. Serves as the point person for data-related tasks on assigned projects. Coordinates the production of data by the assigned department and by other data developers.

Reviews customer requests for quotes and statements of work and compares these with contractual data requirements. Reviews prepared data... to ensure it is adequate, accurate, and complies with contractual data requirements before it is transferred to the customer. Manages the development of program data and ensures that established schedules and budgets are met.

Fields data-related questions and assists with customer-required process reviews. Conduct thorough analysis of GIS data to detect errors and inconsistencies, and proactively devise innovative solutions to improve data accuracy during the data collection process. Analyzing spatial data to identify patterns, trends, and relationships for various projects or initiatives.

Conducting data validation and quality checks to ensure accuracy and reliability. Assisting in the development and implementation of data collection methodologies. This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee.

Duties, responsibilities and activities may change or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice. Required Skills/Abilities: Excellent organizational and time management skills. Ability to function in a fast paced, collaborative environment common to a full time Emergency Operations Center (EOC) or Emergency Services Dispatch Center.

Extensive knowledge of data preparation procedures and requirements. Excellent written and verbal communications skills. Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.

Knowledge of geographically referenced data required (projections, datum, map scales, etc.) Strong problem-solving skills Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and similar software. Candidates should possess some knowledge of various programming languages, such as Python and R, along with fundamental skills in ESRI ArcGIS Pro software. Education and Experience: Required: Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience in the field.

Required: Three (3) years of experience in data analysis License verification, education, and certifications must be provided at the time of application and can be emailed to certification@chloeta.com. Sheet1.title: Data Analyst-Finance - FP&A
Sheet1.description:
JOB SUMMARY:

Data Analysts support the development and optimization of strategic initiatives by generating actionable insights and recommendations from internal and external data. Data Analysts support business growth by using business intelligence tools to mine complex data, identify historic trends, and visualize large datasets. Data Analysts play a critical role in data governance, helping to... create and maintain data standards and quality.

The Data Analyst will work as part of the skilled and passionate Finance and Accounting organization delivering business solutions that enable the various functional business teams. The position's primary role will be to leverage internal and external data using data science techniques to solve business problems.

At Textron Aviation, we are building a community of Data & Analytics professionals with an emphasis on collaboration and cross functional support. You will have the opportunity to work closely with your peers throughout the organization toward a vision of data driven strategy.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

Develop and maintain data reports measuring daily business activities in Power BI, Alteryx, or similar tools using query languages and formula libraries such as SQL and DAX
â€¢ Serves as an internal consultant to business leaders by conducting regular and ad-hoc analyses to convert data into strategic assets.
â€¢ Develop technical as well as process-based solutions addressing business needs
â€¢ Work to improve data quality by assisting data governance efforts in creating and maintaining data quality standards
â€¢ Develop best practices and document proven solutions
â€¢ Interface with other data professionals throughout the organization to embrace cross functional growth in analytics capabilities
â€¢ Gather and document analytics project requirements from business stakeholders
â€¢ Explore and understand the inner workings and market context of an aircraft OEM

EDUCATION/ EXPERIENCE:
â€¢ Bachelor's degree required in MIS, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Business Administration, Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, or related technical field/coursework
â€¢ Aviation experience preferred

QUALIFICATIONS:
â€¢ Strong written and verbal communication skills
â€¢ Experience with Microsoft Office including Excel and PowerPoint
â€¢ Practical application experience with one or more analytics packages such as SAS, R, SQL, Python (& associated libraries), or similar
â€¢ Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar tools
â€¢ Experience working with relational databases and developing complex data sets
â€¢ Ability to identify relevant metrics and explain technical information to a broad audience
â€¢ Desire and ability to learn and leverage new software, tools, and processes in a self-learning environment

Sheet1.title: Associate Research/Data Analyst-CES - Now Hiring
Sheet1.description:
Why you'll love working for this Department:

You will be joining a Department committed to a culture of TEAMWORK to accomplish our goals together, where we deliver excellence through COLLABORATION with partners and stakeholders, embody ACCOUNTABILITY through trust and professionalism, and embrace WORK-LIFE BALANCE by prioritizing respect, boundaries, and time. While working at DHEWD you will be... helping to develop the workforce of the future! Join us as we pursue our vision of "Every Missourian empowered with the skills and education needed for success."

Focus of the Position: This position works within Missouri's Current Employment Statistics (CES) program, which is administered by the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS). The CES unit is housed in the Missouri Economic Research and Information Center (MERIC), which is the state cooperative partner to BLS and the labor market information agency responsible for measuring labor market activity and the economy in Missouri. CES works with employment estimates, average weekly and hourly earnings, and average hours worked in nonagricultural industries, based on payroll records for non-supervisory workers. The data is used by federal and state government as indicators of economic health and by businesses for site location planning and labor contract escalations. The position will be responsible for monthly estimate reviews, annual benchmarking, as well as providing support to other BLS programs. Candidates interested in this position should be flexible and able to adjust as the demand and focus on work requirements shift based on program need.

What you'll do:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function of the job with or without reasonable accommodation.
â€¢ Keep abreast of employment and economic conditions in the state.
â€¢ Review CES preliminary and final estimates monthly.
â€¢ Transfer data via secure networks to BLS and other partners as required.
â€¢ Participate in annual benchmarking as well as preparing the non-covered employees calculations.
â€¢ Coding missing employer information.
â€¢ Other duties related to BLS programs as assigned.
â€¢ Perform other related work as assigned.
â€¢ Demonstrate regular and reliable attendance.

Minimum Qualifications
â€¢ A Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university including or supplemented by three earned credit hours in statistics or research methods.
â€¢ Technical and/or professional experience in a related field may substitute on a year-for-year basis for deficiencies in the required college education.

More reasons to love this position:

The State of Missouri offers an excellent benefits package that includes a defined pension plan, generous amounts of leave and holiday time, and eligibility for health insurance coverage. Your total compensation is more than the dollars you receive in your paycheck. To help demonstrate the value of working for the State of Missouri, we have created an interactive Total Compensation Calculator. This tool provides a comprehensive view of benefits and more that are offered to prospective employees. The Total Compensation Calculator and other applicant resources can be found .

The State of Missouri is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees

Sheet1.title: Health Informatics Data Analyst
Sheet1.description:
Health Informatics Data Analyst

Job title...

Health Informatics Data Analyst

Status:

Regular, Full-time

Reports to:

Quality Management Director

Department:

Quality Management

Pay Type:

Salaried, Exempt

Level:

Non-manager

Revised:

July 2023

About Us

At 26Health, we believe that everyone in our community deserves high quality, comprehensive physical and mental health services, regardless of insurance or ability to pay. We are committed to care that fulfills the needs of the mind, body, and spirit by providing a broad variety of integrated and culturally competent services. We focus on the LGBTQ+ and ally community, including all members of the sexual orientation and gender identity spectrum. All are welcome here.

Job purpose

The Health Informatics Data Analyst is responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex healthcare data from various sources to support clinical, operational, and strategic initiatives. The incumbent will collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data insights and provide valuable recommendations. This work is crucial to positively impact patient care, resource allocation, process improvements, and overall healthcare system optimization.

Duties and responsibilities
â€¢ Gathers and organizes healthcare data from multiple sources, such as electronic health records (EHRs) and other sources of data.
â€¢ Identifies trends and other relationships among data.
â€¢ Develops report specifications and collaborates with leadership to extract information in response to new requests.
â€¢ Ensures data integrity, accuracy, and completeness by applying appropriate data cleansing and validation techniques.
â€¢ Develops clear and visually compelling dashboards, reports, and data visualizations to effectively communicate insights to stakeholders.
â€¢ Collaborates with clinical teams to assess outcomes, efficacy, and impact of healthcare initiatives.
â€¢ Works consultatively with clinical and finance leadership on ROI and clinical program effectiveness monitoring.
â€¢ Monitors and analyzes daily, monthly, and annual patient metrics.
â€¢ Identifies and addresses obstacles/issues as they arise (e.g., scope changes, resource availability, competing priorities, leadership support, low participation)
â€¢ Provides daily numbers to all leadership staff.
â€¢ Provides actionable insights and evidence-based recommendations to support clinical decision-making, resource allocation, and healthcare strategy development.
â€¢ Assists in forecasting and predictive modeling to aid in future planning and risk assessment.
â€¢ Stays updated with the latest developments in health informatics, data analytics, and healthcare technologies, and collaborates with the IT team to implement and optimize data storage, retrieval, and analytical tools.
â€¢ Performs other duties as required.

Qualifications
â€¢ Bachelor's degree in Health Informatics, Biostatistics, Data Science, Computer Science, or related fields.
â€¢ 3+ yearsâ€™ as a Data Analyst in a healthcare or medical research setting.
â€¢ Preferred background includes strong proficiency in data analysis tools such as Python, R, SQL, or other statistical software, experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms, and familiarity with healthcare data standards (e.g., HL7, SNOMED, ICD-10, CPT) and interoperability.
â€¢ Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
â€¢ An equivalent combination of education and/or experience may be considered.
â€¢ An ability to translate other types of data into easily understood formats. Ability to present a summary of quality data for use by the medical staff, administration, and departments in performance improvement.
â€¢ Excellent verbal and written communication skills; communication style that is open and fosters trust, credibility and understanding.
â€¢ Proficient in all MS Office applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
â€¢ Experience working in a healthcare organization is highly preferable.

Working conditions
â€¢ Prolonged periods standing, walking, and/or sitting at a desk and working on a computer may be required.

Physical requirements
â€¢ May require the occasional ability to lift up to 25 pounds.

Direct reports
â€¢ N/A

Additional Information
â€¢ Background screens will be performed, and education will be verified prior to employment.
â€¢ Please be prepared to provide the required information and/or documentation.
â€¢ 26Health is a smoke-free workplace, and smoking is prohibited in all enclosed areas of the property.
â€¢ 26Health is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer.

Sheet1.title: Data Analytics Mentor for Online Bootcamp
Sheet1.description:
Company Overview

Upright is the leading workforce training platform used by colleges, universities, and companies to upskill and reskill workers into high-paying digital careers. Our mission is to establish a network of organizations that collectively serve as the foremost change agent in advancing workforce prosperity...

Why Work at Upright?

A mission-driven organization dedicated to making a difference.

Work alongside a team of insanely talented professionals.

Backed by the biggest names in the industry.

Job Description

We are seeking highly motivated and experienced career professionals to serve as a mentor for learners pursuing a career in Data Analytics. Practically speaking, this is a contracting gig. The mentor is responsible for providing guidance and support to learners as they gain the skills and confidence needed to succeed in the data analytics workplace by working through our coursework. This paid position requires a commitment of 4-8 hours a week for 8 weeks. If you want to give back, bring your expertise and passion to shaping the next generation of data analyst talent at Upright!

Responsibilities:

-Help learners understand the skills required to successfully work in Data Analytics through comprehensive lesson reviews and project & lab exercise reviews in a small group setting (2 hour per week)

-Grade projects and provide meaningful feedback to learners

-Foster honest, frank conversations about workplace skills, such as problem-solving, communication, and collaboration

-Act as a role model and inspiration for learners, sharing your own experiences, challenges and successes in the tech industry

-To be clear, you are NOT responsible for connecting learners to jobs, utilizing your professional networks, or providing leads for which you do not feel comfortable. Our learners succeed because they are prepared, aware, and realistic. This is not a â€œpay to playâ€ situation. We have an amazing career services team and welcome your input to improve our process!

Qualifications:

-2-5 years of experience in Data Analytics

-Strong understanding of the latest trends and best practices in data analytics including the technology used.

-Excellent communication, mentoring, and leadership skills

-Passion for helping learners succeed

-Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects and deadlines

Everything we do at Sunrun is driven by a determination to transform the way we power our lives. We know that starts at the individual employee level. We strive to foster an environment you can thrive in through our commitment to diversity, inclusion and belonging.

Job Summary...

We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join a newly established analytics team within the CFOs organization. This new group will play a critical role in defining new corporate metrics of performance excellence.

Responsibilities:

+ Build and maintain financial and operational dashboards (Tableau) to identify patterns and trends which will support decision-making at the C-Level.

+ Develop and maintain robust and scalable financial and operational data models and data dictionaries for both self-consumption and the broader data analyst community.

+ Partner in the overhaul of data pipelines amidst tech stack migration.

+ Collaborate with technical and business teams to implement best practices for data modeling, data governance, and data quality.

Education and Experience:

+ Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Accounting/Finance, Engineering, or a related field

+ Demonstrated ability in data analysis with financial data, generally 2-4 years.

+ Proficient in SQL (preferably Snowflake), Tableau, and Excel/Google Sheets.

Sheet1.title: Data Growth Analyst & Insights Manager
Sheet1.description:
Job Location
Fayetteville
Job Description...
Do you love diving into data sets? Would you enjoy telling consumer based stories and helping others see the benefit of data-based decision-making? As an Analytics and Insights Director at P&G, you are a Business Leader: you should be an effective communicator, results-oriented, and able to drive insights into actions that improve P&G's business results.
You'll need to mine multiple sources of data, derive meaningful insights, and translate sophisticated results or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower the business to take action to win with consumers. You will be a primary driver of delivering insights that will educate and influence key business decision-making with our Customer and Brand teams.
Business knowledge, data analysis, and interpersonal skills are needed to thrive in this multi-functional leadership team.
You will be leading and improving analytical programs and communicating the results of your business unit/category/region to leaders as well as conducting consumer research. Daily, you can expect to:
- Deliver analytic insights in several business domains including consumer, customer, digital, market & share performance.

The Office of Technology and Innovation (OTI/DoITT) oversees all Citywide technology, privacy, cybersecurity, infrastructure, and telecommunications to ensure the security of, and enhance, City operations and service delivery to New York City's residents, businesses, employees, and visitors.

As the City's technology and innovation leader, OTI is responsible for operating, maintaining and... securing IT infrastructure and systems that touch every aspect of City life from public safety to human services, from education to economic development crossing the full spectrum of governmental operations.
The new Program Management Office under the Strategic Initiatives Division at OTI is responsible for three core areas:

Program Management
New York City agencies work on a significant number of individual IT projects, many of which are interconnected.

The new Program Management Office will coordinate the activities between multiple projects included under the Strategic Initiatives Division to help New York City and OTI meet business objectives, achieve project goals, and stay on budget and on schedule.

Tech Assessments

In conjunction with relevant stakeholders, this team will put a spotlight on at-risk projects across the City by focusing on problem areas and pain points, develop actionable next steps to improve outcomes, and provide quality control.

It will also work as part of a front-end planning unit where new projects can be systematically reviewed in collaboration with project sponsors to further develop scope and ensure the budget is adequate for the task, limiting last-minute additions and changes, allowing project initiation to proceed sooner, with greater clarity, and with fewer obstacles later.

IT Governance & Policy

The Program Management Office will also create standard processes and workflows in collaboration with other OTI Teams to overcome any roadblocks in the successful delivery of IT products and services.

This team will also conduct field surveys and complete external research to identify best practices that could be replicated at OTI.

The Program Data Analyst will report to the Executive Director of Program Management for Strategic Initiatives.

Description:We are committed to work life balance by promoting this hybrid telework opportunity. These job requirements allow the employee to work at a Lockheed Martin-designated office or job site for part of their schedule and has a predefined regular, recurring telework schedule for the remaining part of their work schedule.

At Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems (RMS), we are driven by innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and visionary thinking. In this role as the Data Analyst within the Supply Chain Intelligence team, you will turn data into information -> information into insight-> insight into actionable business decisions across RMS Supply Chain.

Supply Chain's vision is to enable customer and mission success through supply chain strategies and execution that deliver superior operational program performance and create competitive advantage through continuous improvement. It is our mission to deliver affordable supply chain solutions that meet all program requirements and manage supply chain risks to ensure positive supplier performance through all phases of the program life-cycle from capture to sustainment.

Key responsibilities include:
Basic Qualifications:
- Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems

- Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets

- Locate and define data utilizing commercial, government, and LM developed systems/tools.

- Analyze assigned problems for the purpose of root cause analysis, evaluation of potential solutions, etc...

- Enhancing data collection procedures to include all relevant information for developing analytic systems.

- Processing, cleansing, and validating the integrity of data to be used for analysis.

- Organizing data points & presenting results in a clear manner.

- Collaborate with Team Members, Stakeholders and IT teams.

- Comfortable working in "big data" environments (downloading, uploading, aggregating, etc).

- Position may be fully or mostly virtual, located near a major RMS site, with occasional travel for training or in-person collaboration meetings.

SQL experience

Bachelors degree with at least one year of experience
Desired Skills:
The selected candidate should have the ability to perform analysis via multi-criteria decision modeling including statistical & risk analysis, life-cycle cost analysis, performance & cost trade-offs, and business case analysis. They should have a foundational understanding of a broad set of tools to be able to apply the right tool to each data exploration activity.

These tools could include, but are not limited to the following:
Knowledge in software coding especially in Python, R & SQL
Knowledge of applying data science-based technologies in an operations environment, especially involving machine learning and/or artificial intelligence.
Experience in project management
Experience on Supply Chain
Experience in Agile
Experience in Tableau or dashboard development

Previous LM experience
Clearance Level: None
Other Important Information You Should Know
Expression of Interest: By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings.
Ability to Work Remotely: Part-time Remote Telework: The employee selected for this position will work part of their work schedule remotely and part of their work schedule at a designated Lockheed Martin facility. The specific weekly schedule will be discussed during the hiring process.
Work Schedules: Lockheed Martin supports a variety of alternate work schedules that provide additional flexibility to our employees. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits.
Schedule for this Position: 4x10 hour day, 3 days off per week
Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.
At Lockheed Martin, we use our passion for purposeful innovation to help keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work.

Sheet1.title: Credit Data Analyst
Sheet1.description:
Be part of something more.

A majority of our time is spent "at work." We believe that time most meaningful when it's spent around people who care about you and who challenge you. We hire people who know how to make good decisions, because we won't be constantly looking over your shoulder-you'll be empowered to do what's right for our customers. Most importantly, we're a partner. We partner with... our associates to help them thrive personally and professionally. We partner with our communities and the organizations that support them. And, we partner with our customers to create an experience they won't find elsewhere.

The Allowance for Credit team supports the Corporate Finance department by providing data to guide UMB's reserve levels.

As the Credit Data Analyst, you will be responsible for assisting in the execution, reporting, re-calibration, review, automation, and documentation of all Allowance for Credit Loss (ACL) models. This associate will work with the ACL Team assisting in statistical analysis of datasets to identify trends, patterns and correlations that will provide deeper insight into the various loan portfolios. Applying forecasting techniques to ensure conceptual soundness of analytical approaches with supporting documentation. Build and support production and automation of the forecasting processes. This associate will work directly with the ACL Data Science team and senior and executive leadership from the Finance and Credit Administration.

How you will spend your time:
â€¢ Assist with execution of the Commercial, Commercial Real Estate, Consumer, Credit Card Portfolio, and all other loan portfolios' ACL models.
â€¢ Build queries of data and write code to automate model processes.
â€¢ Evaluate model risks and reaches conclusions on strengths and limitations of the models.
â€¢ Communicate and help provide documentation with external and internal parties including external and internal audit, regulators, model risk management, and ad hoc reporting requests from various lines of business within the Bank.
â€¢ Assist with the preparation of the ACL model methodology and support for statistical methods and assumptions.
â€¢ Provide statistical reporting support to both the Chief Credit Officer and the Chief Credit Risk Officer.
â€¢ Other duties as assigned.
We're excited to talk to you if you:
â€¢ Have a bachelor's degree in Statistics/Applied Mathematics, Economics or Computer Science.
â€¢ Have 3 years' experience in risk management processes, data management, model development/ validation, consulting, banking, or other financial services industry.
â€¢ Or have any combination of education and experience that would provide an equivalent background.
â€¢ Demonstrate proficiency in a programming language such as Python.
â€¢ Are proficient in Microsoft Excel and SQL.
â€¢ Exhibit excellent technical writing skills to produce effective reports.
â€¢ Display excellent verbal communication skills to interact effectively with various stakeholders and regulators.
â€¢ Enjoy working independently and under pressure.
â€¢ Have an understanding & ability in working with internal "clients" in a service-oriented and value-add style.
â€¢ Demonstrate project management abilities.
â€¢ Have the ability to work in a fast-paced and challenging environment with a desire to learn and the ability to adapt.
â€¢ Demonstrate basic knowledge & understanding of financial theory and risk related models such as credit risk, market risk, operational risk, asset & liability management, PD/LGD/EAD estimation, and economic capital calculation.

UMB offers competitive and varied benefits to eligible associates, such as Paid Time Off; a 401(k) matching program; annual incentive pay; paid holidays; a comprehensive company sponsored benefit plan including medical, dental, vision, and other insurance coverage; health savings, flexible spending, and dependent care accounts; adoption assistance; an employee assistance program; fitness reimbursement; tuition reimbursement; an associate wellbeing program; an associate emergency fund; and various associate banking benefits. The Mayor's Office of Management and Budget (OMB) is the City government's chief financial agency.

OMB's staff of analysts and experts assembles and oversees the mayor's expense and capital budgets, which fund the services and activities of approximately 90 City agencies and entities.

The OMB Management and Operations Unit examines operations at OMB and city agencies with the goal of gaining more efficient, cost-effective services and improved outcomes.

â€¢ Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms.
â€¢ Combine models through ensemble modeling.
â€¢ Present information using data visualization techniques.
â€¢ Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges.
â€¢ Removing corrupted data and fixing coding errors and related problems.
In addition to subject matter expertise, the position will require a high capacity for independence, relationship building, and creativity.

The candidate should possess the ability to manage multiple, often-competing priorities, and manage staff effectively to ensure properly skilled individuals are assigned to and satisfy specific needs.

Minimum Qual Requirements
â€¢ A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college.
Preferred Skills

Qualifications:
â€¢ An interest in using automated scripting and artificial intelligence tools to clean data and create efficient data pipelines and workflows.
â€¢ Experience in data mining and analyzing and visualizing data.
â€¢ Understanding of machine-learning and operations research.
â€¢ Analytical mind and business acumen.
â€¢ Strong math skills (e.g., statistics, algebra).
â€¢ Problem-solving aptitude.
â€¢ Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills.
â€¢ Ability to think critically and critique assumptions.
Applicants should also have some expertise in at least one of the following areas below:
â€¢ At least one (1) year experience with quantitative data collection, analysis, and reporting, preferably related to campaign finance and elections.
â€¢ Experience using advanced statistical analysis software such as R, Python, SPSS, or equivalent.
â€¢ Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation.
â€¢ Experience in handling reporting packages like Business Objects, programming (e.g., JavaScript, XML, or ETL frameworks), databases.
â€¢ Proficiency in statistics and statistical packages like Excel, SPSS, SAS to be used for data set analyzing.
â€¢ Experience in the development of algorithms leveraging SAS, R, Python, or SQL and NoSQL
â€¢ Experience using business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau) and data frameworks (e.g., Hadoop).
â€¢ Adept at using data processing platforms like Hadoop and Apache Spark.
â€¢ Knowledge of data visualization software like Tableau, or equivalent.

Studies have shown that women, people of color, and other under-represented groups are less likely to apply for jobs unless they believe they are able to perform every task in the job description.

We are interested in finding the best candidate for the job and will consider any equivalent combination of knowledge, skills, education and experience to meet qualifications.

If you are interested in applying, we encourage you to think broadly about your background and skill set for the role.

Additional Information

Requirements:

Assistant Analyst ($51,550+): Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Public Policy Analysis/Administration, or a subject related to the specific assignment with no or one year of full-time experience in budgetary planning/management, audit, compliance, accounting, financial analysis, public policy analysis/administration or a related field.

Senior Analyst ($73,806): Bachelor's degree and a minimum of three years responsible administrative and/or budget experience; or an awarded master's degree in Financial Management, Business, Public Administration, or a field related to the specific assignment and a minimum of one year of responsible administrative and/or budget experience.

Sheet1.description:
Overview

We leverage our world class operations and decades-long distribution partnerships to grow the footprint of our core products and create new, innovative beverage products.

Being a part of the Miloâ€™s TEAm, youâ€™ll get to collaborate with a group of passionate and high-performing people, where everyone feels empowered to do their best work and feels good about the work theyâ€™re doing.

And as a "People First" company, Miloâ€™s is committed to the success and well-being of our associates, customers, and fans, no matter their gender, race or creed. Some of the great things offered that reflect our commitment include:

Position Summary

The Director of Data & Analytics is responsible for managing the Data Team and data infrastructure activities, including development of enterprise data and analytics resources, SQL optimization for enterprise systems, and deployment enterprise data models.

Ownership
â€¢ Support and develop the vision for the organizationâ€™s data strategy, infrastructure, growth, and deployment and ensure they are operationalized in coordination with IT.

â€¢ Manage development and maintenance of data-related systems in the organization and recommend solutions to optimize enterprise applications.
â€¢ Grow and coach team members, while assisting the team in troubleshooting technical issues.
â€¢ Remain current with the latest data management techniques/tools and make recommendations to the IT (Information Technology) leadership.
â€¢ Invest in and is an example of Miloâ€™s Responsibility commitment which includes environmental, social, and corporate governance components.
â€¢ This position has responsibilities essential to Food Safety.

Critical Competencies

â€¢ Building Relationships

Qualifications

This job is sedentary. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet

Sheet1.title: Data Analytics Business Analyst
Sheet1.description:
Position Overview:

The Business Analyst acts as a liaison between Data Analytics and business units across CBH. Situated in the Data Analytics' data capture team, they are responsible for working with end users to fully understand the business definitions of data, including but not limited to, where the data is collected or published, the workflows involved in data collection, gathering both... technical and business specifications for projects, and the technologies necessary to make it a useful resource for data consumers. The incumbent will assist in assuring that technical systems meet the company's data needs for program planning and agency performance measures. The Business Analyst is responsible for translating requirements into specifications involving appropriate analytic reporting and technologies and advocating for the work force work-flow in the creation of new tools/solutions.

Core Expectations:

Community Behavioral Health (CBH) will hold each employee accountable for the following expectations which align with our mission, vision, and corporate code of conduct.
â€¢ Perform key responsibilities as detailed in this job description in a dependable, responsible, and positive manner, consistent with all state and federal guidelines.
â€¢ Serve as a role model by exemplifying professional behavior, language, skills, and attire in order to promptly and accurately serve the needs of stakeholders, members and their families.
â€¢ Assure adherence to CBH policies and procedures so that all work is of the highest quality and delivered in the most culturally competent and cost effective manner.
â€¢ Promote and manage diversity and acceptance within CBH and with all members and stakeholders by honoring and respecting their individuality, dignity and rights.
â€¢ Offer suggestions and develop solutions to help promote effective and efficient work processes and innovative programs.
â€¢ Actively participate in required meetings and complete all mandatory trainings.
â€¢ Maintain high levels of advocacy and member confidentiality to ensure the success of CBH and our mission.
â€¢ Assist in assuring both internal and external program integrity by being alert to and reporting suspected instances of provider and employee fraud, waste or abuse.
â€¢ Evaluate/learn tools to help inform which tools best suit solutions.

Essential Functions:
â€¢ Collaborate with business stakeholders and developers to meet data capture needs of stakeholders
â€¢ Elicit and clearly document requirements and translate requirements into technical specs and mock-ups
â€¢ Create test scripts and perform Quality Assurance and user testing/validation for projects
â€¢ Communicate and collaborate with subject matter experts (SME) to develop training reference materials and lead / assist in end user training
â€¢ Responsible for managing help desk ticket queue and providing technical support and troubleshooting
â€¢ Coordinate with Data Analytics teams in development of Business Intelligence dashboards to provide end user reports
â€¢ Analyzing reporting requirements to determine if needed data already exists in reporting environments
â€¢ Coordinate with developers to create, maintain, and troubleshoot SQL queries for data exchange between systems
â€¢ Coordinate with developers to create reports for data capture projects and create and maintain end user notification processes
â€¢ Investigation and documentation of various work processes
â€¢ Perform other support activities and duties as assigned

Position Requirements:
â€¢ Bachelor's Degree in Computer/Information Science or related field required
â€¢ 3 years of experience in business analysis
â€¢ 2 years of healthcare or health managed care experience preferred
â€¢ Interest in working in behavioral health is required; experience is preferred
â€¢ Other combinations of education and experience may be evaluated on a case-by-case basis

Technical Skills Required:
â€¢ Intermediate level skills using Word, Excel
â€¢ Intermediate database development skills is required
â€¢ Familiarity with SQL required
â€¢ Exposure to data capture technology solutions (i.e.: QuickBase, SharePoint, Formverse, etc.) preferred
â€¢ Excellent critical thinking, analytic, evaluation, and problem-solving skills required
â€¢ Ability to prepare clear, accurate, and informative reports and documentation

Additional Skills required:
â€¢ Excellent written and oral communication skills
â€¢ Strong interpersonal skills with a customer service orientation
â€¢ Ability to communicate effectively between subject matter experts and developers to ensure accurate translation of business needs to implementation efforts
â€¢ Solid presentation skills for both technical and non-technical audiences
â€¢ Excellent training and mentoring skills
â€¢ Ability to work independently and in a team environment
â€¢ Ability to work under tight project deadlines
â€¢ Ability to plan, schedule and organize multiple priorities and high volume of work

Core Competencies:
â€¢ Teamwork and Collaboration: Build and sustain relationships with co-workers and stakeholders and support efforts and deliverables. Encourage unity and help remove barriers to productivity and success.
â€¢ Respect: Treat each other and our members and stakeholders with respect and sensitivity, recognizing the importance of diversity.
â€¢ Member Centric: Focus on the needs of our members by providing value-added services, promoting strong relationships and going beyond basic expectations to achieve the best possible outcomes.
â€¢ Honesty and Integrity: Be open and honest in all we do. Maintain the highest level of integrity at all times.
â€¢ Commitment to Service Excellence: Challenge ourselves to be forward-thinking and committed to providing total member and stakeholder satisfaction, first-in-class service and high quality, innovative programs.
â€¢ Compassion and Empathy: Demonstrate a deep appreciation for another's situation and point of view. Pay attention to emotional cues, listen effectively and show an exceptional level of caring about each person's perspectives and circumstances.
â€¢ Problem Solving: Build and implement logical solutions to resolving challenges/issues by using individual knowledge and experience while taking resources, constraints and CBH values into consideration.
â€¢ Initiative and Self-Directed: Proactively manage time and resources in a way that ensures that all work is done in the most efficient manner while identifying and implementing initiatives without interventions from co-workers, supervisors or stakeholders.
â€¢ Flexibility and Adaptability: Adjust approaches and behaviors in order to meet the constantly changing environment head-on and accomplish CBH and individual goals. Strive to adapt to, accept and embrace change within areas of responsibility.
â€¢ Communication: Effectively and appropriately share thoughts, ideas and information - both written and oral. Respectfully listen to co-workers and stakeholders to gain a full understanding of issues/situations.
